<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Petrified Skin](/Feats.aspx?ID=3756) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Aftermath" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=424" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 56</row>

**Prerequisites**
You have been [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=30) by an enemy.

</column>

---

It might have been a [medusa](/Monsters.aspx?ID=297), [dracolisk](/Monsters.aspx?ID=565), or even a [fossil golem](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1174); regardless of the source, you were the target of some petrifying effect, and an element of that stony gaze has remained with you, both protecting and slowly consuming you. Your limbs are coated with a layer of stone that rests atop your skin and covers more of your body as you lose health. You gain a stone fist [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attack that deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage, has the [shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38) trait, and is in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) weapon group (unlike a normal fist, it doesn't have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) or [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179) traits).

 Additionally, you become more petrified as your life force ebbs. When you have fewer than half your maximum Hit Points, you increase the damage die size of your stone fist from 1d8 to 1d10 and gain resistance to physical damage (except [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374)) equal to your Constitution modifier.

 If you would gain the [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11) condition, you can choose to instead be permanently petrified and avoid the risk of death. When you do, you enter your petrified form with your full maximum Hit Points instead of the normal number. If you become unpetrified, you return to 0 Hit Points, as normal. You can't voluntarily end this petrification. [Counteracting](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) this petrification requires a casting of [_stone to flesh_](/Spells.aspx?ID=311) of a spell level equal to at least half your level, and a successful counteract check against the hard DC for your level. Other effects like _stone to flesh_ have similar limitations, as determined by the GM. Each time you recover from this petrification, you gain a new scar on your skin in the shape of a long, thin crack.
name: Petrified Skin
prerequisite: You have been petrified by an enemy.
